Control

Follow us

INDEPENDENT AND RELIABLE CONTROL SYSTEMS FOR CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE

Control

THE CONTROLS SPECIALISTS

At Proserv, we are controls technology experts with a long-standing reputation – it is the core of our business.

We put controls at the centre of clients’ systems, improving the performance and extending the operational life of essential infrastructure. Whether on greenfield or brownfield assets, our technologies, from their high bandwidth offering enhanced functionality to their unique coexistence capabilities with any legacy OEM system, deliver market-leading reliability and quality.

DISRUPTIVE

BY DESIGN

Whilst we offer a wide portfolio of field-proven products and services, we are continually breaking new ground with our R&D to help clients find more efficient and cost-effective ways to operate.

 

Our engineering services range from conceptualisation through to manufacturing, testing and operation with a complete project management service every step of the way.

 

  • Controls technology designed with reliability and performance in mind.
  • Use of controls to produce data and information on asset performance.
  • Supported by field service engineers focused on uptime performance.
  • Innovative designs and a track record of seamless coexistence with third party systems.
  • Future-proofed solutions – designed to never become obsolete.
  • Components designed beyond industry standards.
  • Fibre, copper, hydraulics and satellite communications links.

Independent and reliable control systems for critical infrastructure.

Control

Supporting a sustainable future
By removing the need to conduct system overhauls, Proserv can reduce the emissions associated with the use of a subsea control module (SCM) by approximately 56%*, when compared to using an industry standard product.

*Subsea Control Module Carbon Emissions Comparative Assessment, 2022 – Carbon Zero, a division of Data Engineering Projects Limited

56

%
Intuitive visualisation of asset integrity and performance.

Monitoring

Addressing insurance issues
Subsea cables faults of wind farms are common, but they can take a lot of time and money to fix. They are actually responsible for 75-80%* of insurance claims by offshore wind industry.
The ECG™ holistic cable monitoring system offers comprehensive visibility across cable assets and terminations. ECG™ provides real-time analysis to enabling proactive decision-making, improving utilisation and reducing OpEx costs.

*ORE Catapult, 2021

80

%
Insights from advanced data analytics and machine learning to predict outcomes.

Intelligence

Operations of the future
73%* of operators believe that digitalisation will have a major impact on future operations.
Proserv is offering analytics and artificial intelligence / machine learning that allow users to convert unused data into actionable information, and implementing intelligent solutions that offer unmatched access to data, real-time monitoring and can predict events.

*The *Kimberlite 2022 Subsea Equipment and Services report

73

%
Improved performance and asset life extension through our expertise and technology.

Optimisation

Addressing the need for effective maintenance
A recent study* showed that 80% of operators reported having subsea wells requiring equipment maintenance or repair in 2021, impacting an estimate of 10% of the subsea well installed base worldwide.
Proserv has the brand heritage and expertise to maintain numerous brands, including Brisco, CAC, EP Solutions. What’s more we will service any OEM equipment, with a promise that our products will never go obsolete.

*The *Kimberlite 2021 Subsea Life of Field Services Report

80

%
